page.title: 09LIFE-STYLE 1.
page.content: Life-styles in the small rural commun- ities that characterize this block are essentially simple. Newfield has some 150 houses, Binchester only 128; West- erton is much smaller. For successful living, peole must enjoy a neighbourly form of self sufficiency. People here must find most of their entertainment & hobbies around the doors. Traditional pastimes include the cult- vation of allotments, often next to the houses, & here you may see pigeon lofts or "crees". There is a Working Mans Club at Newfield, a popular soc- ial meeting place, where apart from drink, bingo and "live" entertainment can be found. At Binchester there is a Community Centre, used variously for adult programmes eg. Old Tyme Dancing, but also the Youth Club-snooker,disco, and "jazz band". (see also pages 10, 11, 12, 13, 14).
